bibl.title: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to W.J. Denno, January 6, 1923

div1.p: Noguchi reports to Denno on the physical examination of the suspected yellow fever case, John Cose.

div1.head: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to W.J. Denno, January 6, 1923
div1.opener:
C O P Y
January 6, 1923
Dear Doctor Denno:
div1.p:
With regard to Mr John Cose, I asked
Doctor Chickering, the Foundation's physician, to make
a physical examination of the patient, in particular
to detect enlargement of the spleen. Doctor Chickering
reports that the examination was negative, except for
very bad teeth and a little harsh breathing at the left
apex, but no rules.

Doctor Chickering suggests that Mr Cose may
have had a catarrhal jaundice.
